Posts.Content: Hi:- I am wonderung how your doctor can possibly tell by the "slope" of your PSA if the cancer is still in the prostate bed or if it had spread to a distant site. If this were possible one could skip radiation and start systemic treatment (ADT) right away. Unfortunately it isn`t. Radiation of the prostate bed is your second (and last) chance for a cure and you should not shy away from it. There is a 25% chance of success. Reinardo
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed in 2001 at PSA 8.9 Gleason 2+3 Triple Hormone Therapy (Leibowitz) in 2002 Active Surveillance thereafter Palliative TUR-P in 12-2009
Posts.Title: 8 Weeks post Surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Winorygun. Since you decided on robotic surgery to go for a cure I suggest you become friendly with the idea of salvage radiation, this being your last chance for a cure. Salvage radiation, after surgery has failed, has a success rate of roughly 50%. HT for a short period of time will improve your chances. Of course, waiting for a couple of months to observe the rise (or not) of PSA and recover from the side effects of surgery will also be a good thing to do, always staying in close contact with your doctor of confidence. Wishing you all the best, Reinardo
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed in 2001 at PSA 8.9 Gleason 2+3 Triple Hormone Therapy (Leibowitz) in 2002 Active Surveillance thereafter Palliative TUR-P in 12-2009
Posts.Title: Robotic Surgery by experienced surgeon

Posts.Content: Hi. In our support group we are discussing the Friedman book "How you and your doctor can fight Breast Cancer, Prostate Cancer and Alzheimer's". Friedman is a biologist currently working with the University of Chicago. His main idea being that not testerone is the villain that causes prostate cancer to grow but rather estradiol being converted from testosterone by means of the aromatase enzyme. Blocking the conversion by means of an aromatase inhibitor (AI) Friedman suggests to fight prostate cancer by supplementing an aging person's testerone up to teenage level. Do any of you fellows know about doctors in the United States who offer this treatment and are there studies or doctor`reports on Testesterone Replacement Therapy (TRT)? Thanks for replying. Reinardo (Germany)
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed in 2001 at PSA 8.9 Gleason 2+3 Triple Hormone Therapy (Leibowitz) in 2002 Active Surveillance thereafter Palliative TUR-P in 12-2009
Posts.Title: The Friedman Book

Posts.Content: Hi, SoMd. TUR-P ist routine in case of benign prostate enlargement but is not supposed a cure for cancer. When I began to develop urinary problems I had a TUR-P. However, relief lasted only a couple of months. Another TUR-P was performed. Same result. After a third TUR-P my urinary tract was ruined and I must have a belly catheter since. I got urinary tract infection und bleeding from the prostate. I then changed doctors and clinic. Following bone scan and CT I had salvage radiation on the prostate and spot radiation on bone metastasis, get bisphosphonate infusions. Bleeding stopped, PSA plummeted. I'm feeling well. I suggest You follow newporter's advice: Get a second opinion. Wishing you all the best. Reinardo
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed in 2001 at PSA 8.9 Gleason 2+3 Triple Hormone Therapy (Leibowitz) in 2002 Active Surveillance thereafter Palliative TUR-P in 12-2009

Posts.Title: Husband is Gleason 8 with skeletal metastases

Posts.Content: Hi:- I suggest that people considerung HT start off with reading Pat Walsh's "Guide to Surviving Prostate Cancer", chapter 12 on androgen deprivation. Most HT being eye-wash, pretty disillusioning, just big business of phamaceutical industry and the medical establishment. Pat Walsh, pioneer in nerve-sparing surgery, associated with Johns Hopkins. Reinardo

Posts.Title: What I Need to Know About HT

Posts.Content: I suggest you read Patrick Walsh "Guide to Surviving Prostate Cancer", third edition chapter 12. He explains surgical and mediical castration, discusses side effects extensively, when to begin hormonal therapy. On page 481 he also discusses what he calls "worldly issues", the widespread inappropriate use of hormonal therapy. Reinardo
